summary.body: This lift rarely seems to be working - something which I have seen cause considerable distress to a number of people (myself included). Today there was a notice stuck to the lift button at the upper level which read approximately as follows:- "This lift button is not working. To call the lift please use lift button on the other level." This might be someone's sick idea of an April Fool's joke - or it might be genuine. Either way, it stinks. But who takes responsibility for this?
summary.subject: Lift at the corner of Speed/Willoughby

summary.body: walked into living room this a.m. to discover an invasion of ants. seem to be coming in through window, Im penthouse floor low rise block. Anyone know of sure way of getting rid of them, and as they are coming from "fire escape" does the Barbican have any resposibility?
summary.subject: ants

summary.body: My TV has gone down - is any anyone experiencing problems? Is it the system or my TV? I susupect it is the system.  I rarely watch TV - say, twice a week for an hour or so, depending on the length of the chosen programme or film - and yet at least once of the two occasions the TV cuts out, usually for a minute or two, but occasionally - like tonight - for longer. Has our expensive new system we paid for been properly installed? Should we all be complaining to the estate office?
summary.subject: tv problems
